v.v: The proverbs of Solomon son of David, the king of Israel.
These proverbs are to teach wisdom and instruction,
that you may receive instruction in order to live
These proverbs are also to give wisdom to the naive,
Let wise people listen and increase their learning,
to understand proverbs, sayings,
The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of knowledge—
My son, hear the instruction of your father
they will be a graceful wreath for your head
My son, if sinners try to entice you into their sin,
If they say, “Come with us,
Let us swallow them up alive, like Sheol takes away those who are healthy,
We shall find all kinds of valuable things;
Throw in your lot with us;
My son, do not walk down that road with them;
their feet run to evil
For it is useless to spread the net in the sight of any bird.
These men lie in wait for their own blood—
So are the ways of everyone who gains riches by injustice;
Wisdom cries aloud in the street,
at the head of the noisy streets she cries out,
“How long, you naive people, will you love being naive?
Pay attention to my correction;
I have called, and you have refused to listen;
But you have ignored all my instruction
I will laugh at your calamity,
when your fearful dread comes like a storm
Then they will call upon me, and I will not answer;
Because they hate knowledge
they would not follow my instruction,
They will eat the fruit of their ways,
For the naive are killed when they turn away,
But whoever listens to me will live in safety
My son, if you receive my words
make your ears pay attention to wisdom
If you cry out for understanding
if you seek it like you would seek silver
then you will understand the fear of Yahweh
For Yahweh gives wisdom,
He stores up sound wisdom for those who please him,
he guards the paths of justice
Then you will understand righteousness, justice, and equity,
For wisdom will come into your heart,
Discretion will watch over you,
They will rescue you from the way of evil,
who abandon the right paths
They rejoice when they do evil
They follow crooked paths,
Wisdom and discretion will save you from an adulterous woman,
She forsakes the companion of her youth
For her house sinks down to death,
All who go in to her will not return again
So you will walk in the way of good people
For those doing right will make a home in the land,
But the wicked will be cut off from the land,
My son, do not forget my commands
for the length of your days and years of your life,
Do not let covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness ever leave you,
Then you will find favor and a good reputation
Trust in Yahweh with all your heart
in all your ways acknowledge him
Do not be wise in your own eyes;
It will be healing to your flesh
Honor Yahweh with your wealth
and your storehouses will be filled up
My son, do not despise Yahweh’s instruction
for Yahweh disciplines those he loves,
The one who finds wisdom is blessed;
What you gain from wisdom is better than what silver will give in return
Wisdom is more precious than jewels
She has the length of her days in her right hand;
Her ways are ways of kindness
She is a tree of life to those who take hold of it,
By wisdom Yahweh founded the earth,
By his knowledge the depths broke open
My son, keep sound judgment and discernment,
They will be life to your soul
Then you will walk on your way in safety
when you lie down, you will not be afraid;
Do not be afraid of sudden terror
for Yahweh will be on your side
Do not withhold good from those who deserve it,
Do not say to your neighbor,
Do not make a plan to harm your neighbor—
Do not argue with a person without a reason,
Do not envy a violent person
For the devious person is detestable to Yahweh,
The curse of Yahweh is on the house of the wicked person,
He mocks mockers,
Wise people inherit honor,
Listen, sons, to a father’s instruction,
I am giving you good instructions;
When I was a son of my father,
he taught me and said to me,
Acquire wisdom and understanding;
do not abandon wisdom and she will watch over you;
Wisdom is the most important thing, so acquire wisdom
Cherish wisdom and she will exalt you;
She will put a wreath of honor on your head;
Listen, my son, and pay attention to my words,
I direct you in the way of wisdom;
When you walk, no one will stand in your way
Hold on to instruction, do not let it go;
Do not follow the path of the wicked
Avoid it, do not go on it;
For they cannot sleep until they do evil
For they eat the bread of wickedness
But the path of righteous people is like the first light that grows brighter;
The way of the wicked is like darkness—
My son, pay attention to my words;
Do not let them turn away from your eyes;
For my words are life to those who find them
Keep your heart safe and guard it with all diligence,
Put crooked speech away from you
Let your eyes look straight ahead
Make a level path for your foot;
Do not turn aside to the right or to the left;
My son, pay attention to my wisdom;
so you may learn about discretion
For the lips of an adulteress drip with honey
but in the end she is as bitter as wormwood,
Her feet go down to death;
She gives no thought to the path of life.
Now, my sons, listen to me;
Keep your path far away from her
In that way you will not give away your honor to others
strangers will not feast on your wealth;
At the end of your life you will groan
You will say, “How I hated instruction
I would not obey my teachers
I was almost completely ruined
Drink water from your own cistern
Should your springs overflow everywhere
Let them be for yourself alone
May your fountain be blessed
for she is a loving deer and a graceful doe.
For why should you, my son, be captivated by an adulteress;
Yahweh sees everything a person does
A wicked person will be seized by his own iniquities;
He will die because he lacks instruction;
My son, if you set aside your money as a guarantee for your neighbor’s loan,
then you have laid a trap for yourself by your promise
When you are caught by your words, my son, do this and save yourself,
Give your eyes no sleep
Save yourself like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter,
Look at the ant, you lazy person,
It has no commander,
yet it prepares its food in the summer
How long will you sleep, you lazy person?
“A little sleep, a little slumber,
and your poverty will come like a robber
A worthless person—a wicked man—
winking his eyes, making signals with his feet
He plots evil with deceit in his heart;
Therefore his disaster will overtake him in an instant;
There are six things that Yahweh hates,
The eyes of a proud person, a tongue that lies,
a heart that invents wicked schemes,
a witness who breathes out lies
My son, obey the command of your father
Always bind them on your heart;
When you walk, they will guide you;
For the commands are a lamp, and the teaching is a light;
It keeps you from the immoral woman,
Do not lust in your heart after her beauty
Sleeping with a prostitute can cost the price of a loaf of bread,
Can a man carry a fire against his chest
Can a man walk on hot coals
So is the man who goes in to his neighbor’s wife;
People do not despise a thief if he steals
Yet if he is caught, he will pay back seven times what he stole;
The one who commits adultery has no sense;
Wounds and shame are what he deserves
For jealousy makes a man furious;
He will accept no compensation
My son, keep my words
Keep my commands and live
Tie them on your fingers;
Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,”
in order to keep yourself from the adulterous woman,
At the window of my house
I looked at the naive people,
That young man passed down the street near her corner,
It was twilight, in the evening of the day,
There a woman met him,
She was loud and wayward;
Now in the streets, then in the market place,
So she grabbed him and kissed him,
“I made my peace offering today,
so came I out to meet you,
I have spread coverings on my bed,
I have sprinkled my bed
Come, let us drink our fill of love until morning;
For my husband is not at his house;
He took a bag of money with him;
With much talk she turned him;
He went after her suddenly
until an arrow pierces through its liver.
Now, my sons, listen to me;
May your heart not turn aside onto her paths;
She has caused many people to fall down pierced;
Her house is on the paths to Sheol;
Does not Wisdom call out?
On the hilltops beside the road,
Before the gates at the entrance into the city,
“It is to you, people, that I call;
You who are naive, learn wisdom;
Listen, because I will speak of noble things,
For my mouth speaks what is trustworthy,
All the words of my mouth are just;
All of them are straight for the person who understands;
Acquire my instruction rather than silver;
For Wisdom is better than jewels;
I, Wisdom, live with Prudence,
The fear of Yahweh is to hate evil.
I have good advice and sound wisdom;
By me kings reign, and rulers make laws that are just.
By me princes rule,
I love those who love me,
With me are riches and honor,
My fruit is better than gold, even fine gold;
I walk in the path of righteousness,
As a result, I make those who love me inherit wealth;
Yahweh created me at the beginning,
In ages long ago I was made—from the first,
Before there were oceans, I was given birth—
Before the mountains were settled
I was born before Yahweh had made the earth or the fields,
I was there when he established the heavens,
I was there when he established the clouds above and
I was there when he made his limit for the sea,
I was beside him, as a skilled craftsman;
I was rejoicing in his whole world,
Now, my sons, listen to me,
Listen to my instruction and be wise;
The one who listens to me will be blessed.
For whoever finds me, finds life,
But he who fails, harms his own life;
Wisdom has built her own house;
She has slaughtered her animals; she has mixed her wine;
She has sent out her maids; she calls out
“Who is naive? Let him turn aside here!”
“Come, eat my food,
Leave your naive actions and live;
Whoever disciplines a mocker receives abuse,
Do not reprove a mocker, or he will hate you;
Give to a wise person, and he will become even wiser;
The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of wisdom,
For through me your days will be multiplied,
If you are wise, you are wise for yourself,
The woman of foolishness is ignorant;
She sits at the door of her house,
She is calling out to those who pass by in the streets,
“Let anyone who is naive turn aside here,”
“Stolen waters are sweet,
But he does not know that the dead are there,

v: to teach words of insight,
by doing what is right, just, and fair.
and to give knowledge and discretion to young people.
and let discerning people get guidance,
and words of wise people and their riddles.
fools despise wisdom and instruction.
and do not lay aside the rules of your mother;
and pendants hanging from your neck.
refuse to follow them.
let us lie in wait for blood,
let us hide and attack innocent people for no reason.
and make them like those who fall into the pit.
we will fill our houses with what we steal from others.
we will all have one purse together.”
do not let your foot touch where they walk;
and they hurry to shed blood.
they set an ambush for their own lives.
unjust gain takes away the lives of those who hold on to it.
she raises her voice in the open places;
at the entrance of the city gates she speaks,
How long, you mockers, will you delight in mockery,
and how long, you fools, will you hate knowledge?
I will pour out my thoughts to you;
I will make my words known to you.
I reached out with my hand, but there was no one who paid attention.
and paid no attention to my correction.
I will mock you when the terror comes—
and disaster sweeps over you like a whirlwind,
when distress and anguish come upon you.
they will desperately call for me, but they will not find me.
and did not choose the fear of Yahweh,
and they despised all my correction.
and with the fruit of their schemes they will be filled.
and the indifference of fools will destroy them.
and will rest secure with no fear of disaster.”
